Class InputHandler

java.lang.Object
java.awt.event.KeyAdapter
controller.InputHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, EventListener
public class InputHandler extends KeyAdapter implements MouseListener, MouseMotionListener
Centralized input manager for handling all keyboard and mouse events. It tracks the state of pressed keys and mouse buttons, providing a clean interface for other parts of the game to query user input.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    InputHandler()
    Constructs an InputHandler and initializes all input states.

      public InputHandler()
      Constructs an InputHandler and initializes all input states.

  • Method Details

    • resetAllInputs

      public void resetAllInputs()
      Resets all keyboard and mouse input states to their default (unpressed) values.

    • resetKeys

      public void resetKeys()
      Resets only the keyboard input states. For simplicity, this currently resets all inputs.

    • resetMouse

      public void resetMouse()
      Resets the mouse button state after a click has been processed.

    • resetVerticalKeys

      public void resetVerticalKeys()
      Resets only the vertical movement keys (up/down).

    • isKeyPressed

      public boolean isKeyPressed(int keyCode)
      Checks if a specific key is currently being held down.
      Parameters:
      keyCode - The key code to check (e.g., KeyEvent.VK_ESCAPE).
      Returns:
      True if the key is pressed, false otherwise.

    • isMouseButtonPressed

      public boolean isMouseButtonPressed(int buttonCode)
      Checks if a specific mouse button is currently pressed.
      Parameters:
      buttonCode - The mouse button code (e.g., MouseEvent.BUTTON1).
      Returns:
      True if the specified button is pressed, false otherwise.

    • consumeKeyPress

      public boolean consumeKeyPress(int keyCode)
      Checks if a key was pressed and then "consumes" the event by removing it from the set. This is ideal for single-press actions like navigating menus.
      Parameters:
      keyCode - The key code to check.
      Returns:
      True if the key was pressed, false otherwise.
